message:
I'm a 1st year student in computer science and you know if i rely on what i'm gonna learn in faculty i'll setup windows after my graduation :D,  so i need some courses to start with (I don't know any thing about computer science ), if you can suggest me some courses(Arabic or English ) or books i'll be grateful
Thanks in advance.

data.message:
http://www.codemasry.com/
Coursera/Udacity/Edx are your only friends.
Study data structures well is the first and most important step
You can start with Harvard Cs50 or mit intro to computer science
Start with CS50 on edx
Harvard CS50 on edx
If you really believe so , leave the college and do not waste your time
https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/electrical-engineering-and-computer-science/6-00sc-introduction-to-computer-science-and-programming-spring-2011/

start CS50 
look at these
https://www.google.com/about/careers/students/guide-to-technical-development.html
https://github.com/open-source-society/computer-science
Freelancer.com

This is a full curriculum of Computer science starting from zero ending with being a  hero :D 
it states also the expected time to finish each course .. 

i recommend this list for the following reasons : 
1- it is very clear and organized . 
2-it is up to date and the contains the newest courses in the field . 
3- it is made by a good group of real world software engineers . 
4-it goes along with the Computer science curriculum studied in university . 
5-the community and the other students who are studying the same courses so when stuck you can ask for help . 

https://github.com/open-source-society/computer-science
udacity is your Best friend.

"I'm a 1st year student in computer science and you know if i rely on what i'm gonna learn in faculty i'll setup windows after my graduation"

I want you to read your phrase again and think about it for few minutes. 

I can only partially agree if you stated "If i tried learning the way i used to do at school".  if not,  try to think again what is exactly is your problem:
- Educational institute?
- The instructors/professors?
- The curriculum? 
- The field of computer science itself?
- Being in Egypt w 5alas?

Make sure to take introductory courses that give you an overview of what computer science entails before jumping into specific courses on programming - try MIT open courses: https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/intro-programming/

My advice basically is to do projects as possible as you can. Make sure you always be part of something.  This is the real exp you should follow. And the best project based platform for software/dev skills is udacity. This platform is amazing.

Plus, if you can contribute in any open source  is project it would be excellent.
Suhil
let's take this course as the starting point. https://www.udacity.com/course/intro-to-computer-science--cs101
check this https://github.com/open-source-society/computer-science

CS50 is great start or 
google's guide for cs new students :
https://www.google.com/about/careers/students/guide-to-technical-development.html
Amar Magdy

Your expectations are weird. You should expect your college to teach you computer science. In fact, if you pay attention to the foundational stuff (data structures, compilers, OS, AI, image processing) you will be a very good developer. I was taught this stuff in college, in Egypt and it made all the difference.

The coding skills, the experience with different platforms will not come from courses but from doing stuff and playing with stuff yourself, but you should absolutely assume the courses in College will help and pay attention to them. I am talking about Egypt. Every good Egyptian developer I met here in the US in big companies was good from back home paying attention to computer foundation stuff.
First of all you have to decide what is your target? Do you want to become android developer?ios developer?web developer? game developer? 3d modeler? Since each specialist have different courses

listen to my advice (y)
